Yes it works! Make shure you to open up the disk image (.dmg), then open up Disk Utilities and create on you're own hard drive or external disk (recommended) and make shure you create 2 EXTRA partitions. One for the operating system and one to install the OS and make that no less then 7 Gb. Click to restore in disk utilities, drag the installation partition to the output and obviously the INSTALESD as source. After that just reboot the mac, when you hear the "starting mac sound" hold the option key and select the installation partition. YOU WONT SEE THE PARTITION WHERE YOU WOULD ADD MOUNTAIN LION YET, so select the install partition and just follow the steps on your screen and ofcours make shure to select the proper disk where you like to add Mountain Lion. After installation, press option key and select the mountain lion disk and here you go....

Oh yes and guys, the change for succeed the installation is pretty much 0 if you do it as usual. You really need to do it as explain above.
Thanks for the upload lfla ! :)

Default_GIU has it all right. It works like a charm with their instructions. Do make sure to make two partitions -- you can't install on the same partition that you restore the installer to. Overall works like a charm, more refined than lion in many ways.
No problems at all: just downloaded, mounted the image and clicked on install. It even updates with appstore. Thanks to the uploader!
